DataElement.preferredName: Patient Clinical Trial Safety Compliance Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related for the cooperation by the patient for evaluating the state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions as required for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related for the cooperation by the patient for evaluating the state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions as required for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.:The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.:Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions.
Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient, in the opinion of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient, in the opinion of the investigator, able to comply with the safety monitoring requirements of the study

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient, in the opinion of the investigator, able to comply with the safety monitoring requirements of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing and able to comply with the protocol for the duration of the study including undergoing treatment and scheduled visits and examinations

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator is the patient unable or unlikely to comply with the dosing schedule and study evaluations?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator, is patient unable to comply with the safety monitoring requirements of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any significant issues listed below that would compromise patient safety or compliance with protocol therapy, or interfere with consent, study participation, follow up, or interpretation of study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a significant concurrent disease, illness, psychiatric disorder or social issue that would compromise patient safety or compliance with protocol therapy, or interfere with consent, study participation, follow up, or interpretation of study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any medical, psychiatric or social issues that would compromise patient safety or compliance with protocol therapy, or interfere with consent, study participation, follow up, or interpretation of study results?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient, in the opinion of the investigator, not able to comply with the study procedures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have the psychological ability and general health that permits completion of the study requirements and required follow up?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator, is the patient unable to comply with the study procedures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the opinion of the investigator, is this patient able to comply with the safety monitoring requirements of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient in the investigators judgement unlikely to complete protocol-required study visits or procedures, including follow-up visits, or comply with the study requirements for participation, or in the investigator's judgment, is the patient likely to develop significant toxicity and morbidity from CAR-T cell expansion mediated inflammation based on location of tumor site?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.2 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002682. ak 2023.6.26 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002550. ak
